title: Fantastic Experience
body: I was given a first class examination. I must admit i wasn't expecting the high level i received. From start to finish i was told what to expect and what to do next. My examination was a little uncomfortable, but the nurses reassured me while gently rubbing my shoulder. My consultant made me feel that my problems were valid and gave me a plan of what was to come. They also put me in immediately for a blood test and advised of medication.  Even the nurse who took my bloods advised against a vein i suggested as it would be more uncomfortable. Many thanks.

title: Fantastic Practice
body:
I am moving out of the area and I'm absolutely gutted I can't stay with the surgery. I don't visit the GP very often but when I do and need an appt. I usually get one the same day when phoning at 8 am.
I order repeat prescriptions by email and they are sent to my local chemist and are always there when I pick them up 2 days later. Recently I used MyGP the online service where a doctor rang me back the same morning, she made me an appointment convenient to me and I got sorted straight away. Excellent service and staff.

title: Good and Kind Care given
body: I have a few recent consultations at this practice with 3 of the GPs, a practice nurse and a healthcare assistant-both on the phone and face to face. Each time I have been spoken to or seen promptly and then treated with great kindness and care. The GPs have always listened well, explained things clearly, reassured when needed and have given me chance to share in any care or treatment given to me. I have felt very happy with both the service given and care I have received. Thank you.

title: Really professional and helpfull
body: We had been unable to get an appointment at our local practice for a few weeks so they passed us over to Brewood medical practice. We had an appointment within an hour set for the following day (telephone) the Dr was working remotely so he rang at 7pm. Very professional and thorough with his questions regarding our daughter. Within 10 minutes the consultation ended and a solution agreed upon. Great service and very professional.

author: cricketdt89
title: Maternity Care
body: I want to take this opportunity to say a massive thankyou to the staff in Antenatal clinic, delivery suit and 2 west. I had my little girl Maria in April, in Craigavon Area hospital and I have to say the care and attention I received was above and beyond. In delivery suite a special mention to Dr Adams and her team. Also to Sr Corry and Kirsty in delivery suite, thank you for taking such good care of me and Maria. In 2 west I’d also like to say thanks to Lauren and to Ruth for also being very attentive and compassionate. Also to Dolly and Donna and the rest of the Maternity team. I cannot thankyou enough for the safe arrival of our beautiful baby daughter Maria. You are all wonderful.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Terrible Service
body: I'm not exaggerating when I say that I waited over 15 minutes in the foyer for a form to be handed to me waving at an intercom and getting no response..staff don't acknowledge that your waiting and even when they have finished on the phone they proceed to talk amongst themselves.  Ive had many jobs in customer facing roles and I always assumed you should acknowledge people even if you can't deal with them immediately.  Even before the pandemic I found staff quite rude behind there sliding window,  not looking up and talking amongst themselves...it really doesn't hurt to be polite and I find both surgery's not at all friendly and welcoming .

title: Minor Injuries Unit - Reception
body:
Twisted my ankle and was in severe pain. Turned up to the reception area of the Minor Injuries Unit to find a receptionist on the phone. Even though I was clearly visible and in pain the receptionist continued her conversation about an administrative issue to do with a ‘sticky note’ needing to be put on a piece of paper. This went on for about 10 minutes while I remained standing.
Upon putting phone down I was abruptly asked my name, what was the problem and before I could finish a single sentence told to ‘sit down there and wait’.
It was like a scene out of faulty towers. Appalling service!
Date of attendance 30/06/21, time 10am.

author: MumJD
title: Birth of daughter
body:
I had an elective c-section planned after a traumatic first birth. I had anxiety surrounding the planned birth but the midwifes from community to ward 16 couldn’t do enough to make me feel more at ease during this time. Big thanks to Leigh who helped me through the birth and Claire and all the other staff on ward 16 who cared for me and my daughter so well during our stay. My experience was amazing and looking back I would do it all again. First time breastfeeding and I am loving our breastfeeding journey so far, thanks to all the help  
from the staff who made me feel comfortable in doing this. Every staff member I came in contact with was amazing, absolutely no faults for the care received while an inpatient. Midwifes are the real life superheroes.

title: Poor Service
body:
Extremely difficult to get an appointment online or on the phone. They say appointments are on line from 7.00am. Logged on 10 minutes before this for last 7 days and have been unable to book an appointment.
No appointments show up, was refreshing the page every few seconds and no appointments show. You ring and when you finally get through after being on hold for 1 - 2 hours, the appointments have gone and you need to ring tomorrow again.
They processes need to change as currently it is so difficult to get an appointment, especially if you are working. 
If you try to book an e-consultation, you cannot do so for under 18s.
Overall it is a very poor service that has been like this for a long time. Change your procedures and processes.

author: Thisisridiculous
title: General Anxiety, health anxiety and depression
body:
Health anxiety was the cherry on top of general anxiety. It got to the point I knew I needed help, alongside medication.  
I was seen too quickly, a trainee therapist called me and asked if I was happy to continue with a trainee under close observation. My therapist was Chantal, a trainee. We went through balanced thoughts, had lots. of discussions, we did helpful in between session tasks, We spoke about muscle relaxation, breathing techniques, positive and balanced thoughts.  
Chantal was amazing. It took me just 2 or 3 sessions in which I was very sceptical over, to really relax and open up, with no feeling of being judged or anything.  
She spoke to me professionally, but also friendly, made me feel at ease, like I was talking to a friend. We had giggles and she truly made me feel comfortable and relaxed in the sessions we had.  
She taught me balanced thoughts, positive thinking, she understood me in a way other as couldnt, which made me understand my anxiety and depression myself. My therapy has come to end but I truly. believe I would still be in trouble if I hadnt have come forward for more help as opposed to just medicatation. I use everything I have learned on a daily basis, and I am truly thankful. I wish Chantal all the best in her career and I truly thank her for her help amd support.

title: NEED SERIOUS IMPROVEMENT
body:
This surgery has got so bad over the past couple of years, someone seriously needs to look into the practise and the way the appointment schedule works. Takes ages to get through then you get told to call the next day.. 
You wonder why there is a strain on hospitals when you have a GP Surgery like this that you can never get an appointment at so everyone has to then go the hospital to even just be prescribed some antibiotics that could of been dealt with over the phone with your doctor. 
The doctors are good once you get an appointment but the whole process to actually to be able to speak to them is disgusting. 
You shouldn’t have to feel uncomfortable when calling your local doctors, this has probably put many people off even calling them anymore.
This is very worrying when you have children and elderly parents who rely on you to speak to the surgery for them.

title: largely inaccessible and can't manage repeat…
body: I gave up trying to make contact by 'phone months ago and so, yet again, had to journey to the surgery to chase up a repeat prescription. The fifth time in less than a year when they failed simple task of sending my prescription. This used to be a good practice but has deteriorated shockingly in past two years. I despair.

title: Discourteous staff
body:
I was left frustrated and disappointed by the lack of basic manners from the associate physician and both the receptionists.

They are incompetent and extremely rude

title: a big thank you to all the staff
body: Arrived at A&E with food stuck in my throat (really stuck). I was well cared for in A&E and eventually moved to the gastric ward. Everybody was so helpful, friendly, and caring. I could not have asked for better care. After all the pressures the NHS has been under it was not on show in the areas I visited. A great big thank you to all.

title: 7.5 hours ( 3 calls to 111 ) no call back
body: I called at 3pm for my 4 year old to be told a clinician would call back - no timescales though. 7pm came and no call back. I phoned to chase up to be told it looked like her name wasn't on the callback list anymore and they would mark as urgent. 9pm and no call back so I phoned to chase up again to be told my child is in the queue and they would again put a note to say its urgent as I also have a 1 year old and I am a single parent so if she needed to be seen I would have to make sure one of my parents was here to watch my youngest. It's now 10.30 and no call back. My 4 year old is now in bed after falling asleep so I will see how they are in the morning and phone my surgery at 8am to be told there's no telephone appointments left so then what do I do??? Ring 111 and wait all day for a call back. Children are getting forgotten about with Covid going on and this isn't Covid!!

title: Lovely home and the best staff
body:
Clean environment
Lovely food,caring patient friendly experienced staff nothing too much trouble
The four wings  with lounges and dining rooms give intimate feel Modern comfortable chairs for residents
Extra facilities like the  hairdressing salon and the animals especially Pumpkin the cat!
Cannot recommend Briar Close House and its staff highly enough
Thankyou

title: Great medical staff shame about the receptionist
body:
I attended the endoscopy department on 19th June for a rather embarrassing and concerning investigation of the colon but I must say all clinical staff members were amazing. They were considerate, patient and helpful whilst maintaining my respect and dignity at all times and even provided me with tea and biscuits after my procedure as I had been fasting for an extensive period of time.
The only disappointing aspect of my experience was the ill mannered receptionist who was on the desk in the endoscopy department. I just couldn’t understand why she choses to be in a customer service role when she clearly didn’t want to be there on a Sunday  morning. She barely uttered a word and did not even have the courtesy of making eye contact with me or even with my partner who arrived to collect me later the same day. This procedure is invasive enough without a receptionist making patients feel even more anxious. A smile and a welcome greeting goes a long way especially when you are sat waiting with the risk of bad news.

title: getting basic health care should not be this hard
body: waited the week needed to allow prescription to be ready to be told the doctor had not sent it to the pharmacy.  went to gp practice but receptionist most unhelpful and obstructive. patient care non existent

title: Cardiology
body: Visited the cardiology department today and was highly impressed with their procedures . The consultant was excellent , very very thorough and I particularly liked that although he was wearing a mask during the consultation he had a large photo of himself without the mask around his neck .what a brilliant idea . I felt thoroughly confident that they would get to the bottom of my issues . Well done Chesterfield Royal Hospital !

readBy.name: Chesterfield Royal Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Disgusting
body: I attended the A&E department having been sent by my GP. I was in a very anxious and upset state and was very worried about my health/condition.  On arrival we saw a paramedic (rude man not wearing a mask), the first thing he said was ‘you can’t come in sir!’ to my husband, while waving his hand in a rude manner. I fully understand the covid rules and why my husband wasn’t allowed in but this was totally unnecessary and unprofessional. He then said ‘why have they sent you here? You shouldn’t be here.’  He sent me to another door saying they probably wouldn’t see me. At the second door, zero covid compliance was in place; no masks were worn by door staff. I had to request to sanitise my hands. Many staff standing around talking; some even watching the football on their phones. Triage nurse was rude and ignored me, doctor didn’t know what to do with me and walked off leaving me in the cubicle for an hour and a half. The cubicle had blood on the floor and examination couch, which did little to ease my anxiety. A good clean wouldn’t go amiss! Staff didn’t know what was going on with/for me as that doctor had then finished his shift. I was put in another waiting room where zero covid restrictions were in place. I felt very unsafe covid-wise and was in a lot of pain and feeling very anxious. Where is the care? Absolutely disgusting. I know that these people are busy but honestly this was a horrendous experience. I am a human being who was in pain and distress. If this is the treatment available, it’s a very sad state. I will never attend this A&E again. A waste of 5.5 hours of my life and 5.5 hours of pain, anxiety and discomfort for absolutely nothing. I’ve had to return to my GP to be referred to a different (hopefully better) hospital.

title: Think there above the law
body: Thinking there above the police bullying you into wearing a face mask even tho your exempt, standing less than a meter from you surrounding you and aggressively shouting and loss of temper by the staff to force you out of the builder. sorry your not the police and if you dont know the law or the rules, go back to college.

title: Very caring and knowledgeable GP
body:
My GP is very caring, knowledgeable, kind and supportive, she loves her job and loves helping her patients. She has a high level of empathy and she works extremely hard. It's super difficult job being a GP, it's a massive responsibility plus I am sure it's very stressful too and the hours must be very long but my lovely GP gives her heart into helping her patients. She referred me to see specialists (neurosurgeons) and even though I have very severe health issues, and my brutal symptoms keep changing from one to another which is so scary and painful, she is able to always tell me kind words and give me her best recommendations with an open mind and without jumping into conclusions too quickly. If there is an angel on earth in form of a doctor, then it must be this GP. Thank You so much for everything dearest doctor.
  
The receptionists are also very kind and helpful and they work very hard to help all patients. 

Well done to the entire practice for the help provided to us patients even through such difficult circumstances such Corona. You all should feel very appreciated - from GP's, nurses, receptionists, cleaners etc, all of you involved in making this practice such an amazing place full of healing, understanding, compassion and kindness.

Thank you so much to every single person in this practice.

title: Treatment of Diabetic Muslim patient .
body: I find the practice dislikes any justified criticism . Also , as a diabetic Muslim , I was asked to bring a weekly dietary sheet to my annual review . This contained several goat and other curries amongst other things and took 2 hours to type . The G.P. looked at it for 5 seconds then screwed it up & threw in the waste without a word !!!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Cared for, Supported and made well again
body:
I underwent a total hip replacement. 
Maintaining a COVID 19 Green environment can make getting into hospital feel a little cold and uninviting, But once on the ward I was welcomed and made to fell safe and reassured on the details of the procedure.
Major Surgery like this is not without pain /discomfort. This was managed well.
I witnessed several fellow patients discharged the day after the operation  looking well  and confident using their new hips.
My recovery took a couple of extra days. 
I was supported through this, reassured  and kept safe until I was ready to utilise my replacement HIP and could demonstrate to the physio team that I was strong enough to leave.
The teamwork from consultants, Anaesthetist, theatre staff and nursing staff, physio, catering and housekeeping was an inspiration.
They are all exceptionally busy reducing the COVID back log but everyone made sure I was given the care and attention I needed, despite my recovery not following the most ideal pathway.
Gratefully yours

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Excellent Practice
body: They provide a excellent service and take good care of there patients and make sure that your visit to the practice goes smoothly. Well Recommend.

title: Unprofessional practice
body:
The behaviour of the receptionists is simply appalling. 
Every gp has a different opinion, and they have to look on Google to interpret your symptoms. I was told while booking for an emergency appointment that varicose veins are not treated by the NHS unless they bleed out/about to lose legs, very scary practice indeed.

title: Poor Service
body: Completed a on line form. Received a reply that I could have to wait upto 11 days. Also telephone the surgery took over an hour to be connected, told that I could not speak to a clinician and to phone 111 if I needed further help.

title: All Fantastic in A & E!!
body: Even though I did wait over 5 hours the help I received was fantastic the lovely nurse who looked after me, lady who took my bloods and gave IV antibiotics, the doctor that came from orthopaedics, they lady that cleaned my infected foot were all so nice, I had a nasty infection in my foot but they made me feel so much better.  I went home all clean with bandages and antibiotics with the birds twittering...just a big THANK YOU xx

author: Lh*70
title: Speech and language therapy
body: Speech therapist called to check my mothers ability to swallow. Mum has Lewy body dementia and has had a recent choking episode. Having observed mum eating it was decided she should have a pureed diet and level 1 thickened fluids. Therapist was friendly and very knowledgeable. Home visit was within 5 days of referral excellent service from the western health and social care trust.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: normatc99
title: Rapid covid test
body:
I arrived 15 minutes early it was no problem the tester came out and explained what was going to happen  
I was then tested which was  
Not as unpleasant as I thought it would be  
I then waited in the carpark for my result

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: aquilamd93
title: Vaccination
body:
Medical staff were very good  
Event security staff were rude

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: fornaxyf97
title: Excellent Service
body: I went in yesterday evening, to get my ear checked after having an operation for ear cancer recently. It was a quick visit - I went in, there was no hanging about. I was attended to and Mr Curry told me everything was OK. It was an excellent service. Thank you!

author: Gragd49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Stroke Rehab
body: The Community Stroke Team have been fantastic. 10/10 service. Gavin, Hannah and Abi have all been knowledgeable and very helpful. "Speech therapist" doesn't do justice to the extend of the profession.

title: Lovely experience
body: I had an appointment in the Audiology ward in King George Hospital on Wednesday 23rd June 2021 at 5:15pm. The audiologist working with me was great. I know the NHS is experiencing a great deal of demand with pandemic (and before that as well), but they took time to talk me through what was happening in my ear, my options, and the results of my hearing test. I have had hearing tests before but I’ve never had the results explained to me so thoroughly. I’m very appreciative of the time the audiologist took, their kindness, and their helpful advice on the options available to me at the time. I wasn’t able to get his name but please pass my thanks on. Lovely experience

title: Lack of care
body:
My sons GP sent a referral to the spine team.  We did the E referral there was no reply.   I phoned was told 3-4 months.  Still heard nothing I phoned again.  I am told his been triaged and sent on to spinal physio.   I am disappointed no xray, no phone call, no examination still no communication.  I tried to find who the Dr was that triaged him.  I was given the secretary number who said go back to patient centre who said they couldn't discuss it with me.  
I see my son daily in tears his in so much pain. I watch him sometimes legs giving way at least a phone call or letter would give hope.  Being ignored and passed from person to person is upsetting.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

author: wezenje36
title: Covid swabbing
body: Received on time. Instructions were clear. The throat swab made me gag but persevered and then took the nose which was fine. Having only to travel to Holsworthy rather than Barnstaple was handy. Awaiting my result & so can have my operation on Thursday!

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Bern K
title: Home Visit by a Occupational Therapist.
body:
Recently my health has suffered and my mobility has been greatly affected by pain.  
My injuries are from my service in HM Forces. My O/T was Esther  
This lady was so professional and her caring side was immediately apparent, because of her empathy I felt relaxed enough to ignore my pride and tell her exactly how I was suffering. Consequently she arranged for several items to be delivered to my home which will greatly enhance my day to day living.  
On top of the home visit she has made several follow up calls to confirm I'm OK. You have no idea how much the calls made me feel so cared for. This O/T is a excellent Ambassador for the NHS and I count myself very fortunate to be one of her patients. Would it be possible for her line manager to be made aware of the excellent staff that they have?

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Doctors who won’t see patients
body: The reluctance of doctors seeing patients is is utterly disgraceful, the surgery is like Fort Knox ie you can’t get in, patients are fobbed off to see the physio instead of a face to face with a doctor. And this is despite the fact that most of the population has been vaccinated.

title: Excellent service!
body: I attended the treatment centre for an MRI scan. The staff were all very friendly, knowledgeable, professional and efficient. They thoroughly explained the procedure and were happy to answer questions. They were very vigilant regarding safety and double checked my pre-completed questionnaire to ensure that the scan was given safely. The department was very covid secure and all protocol was followed to the letter. I felt very safe in the environment. I can’t rate them highly enough! A wonderful experience. Thank you to all of the caring staff.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Staff great but wards are chaos
body: I’m currently in maternity ward having had my 3rd c section. Unlike last time I was here partners are now permitted to stay overnight in a chair which is lovely  especially for first time parents. There are 4 bays. Two of us have partners with us, two don’t (I’m alone as my husband is home with our other children). Unfortunately there seem to be no rules whatsoever about night time hours on wards. The man next to me was watching a film on his phone and munching on snacks at midnight. The woman opposite has conducted 3 noisy non-urgent non-important telephone conversations on loudspeaker between 12:30am & 6:00am. I firmly believe that people should be given some “ward etiquette” information upon admission. Such as no non-urgent phone calls between 10pm and 7am. No watching tv on your phone after 10pm unless you have headphones. Thinking of your fellow patients and trying to be mindful that others are trying to rest and recover at night. I completely understand that wards are always going to be noisy with babies crying, snoring, medications being distributed and observations carried out 24/7. But it seems people need reminding how to behave and to consider others, it’s deeply frustrating as a patient trying to sleep. Also since I can’t get off the bed (catheter) it’s a bit difficult to complain to staff about people who you’re only separated from by a curtain. I’m in a maternity ward trying to recover from a surgical birth and I really resent being kept awake by a bloke who wants to kick back, eat crisps and watch a film in the early hours. Women’s well-being should be put first here of all places.

author: Merry76
title: My treatment by an A&E Doctor
body:
Having been referred by my GP back in March to a Gastro consultant, I had only received two missed calls during that time with no message/number/contact of what to do. I was now in considerable discomfort, passing blood a lot, in pain, struggling to eat and sleep etc.  
I had been sent a referral letter which had the wrong reference on it. On a Monday in June 2021 I decided to go to the hospital to try to get some answers (N&N in norwich). I went to A&E and explained my situation and the people at the door felt I should go in and be seen.  
The first Doctor on duty who saw me, made me feel like a complete hypochondriac and had me in tears. Even the nurse commented that they were in the wrong profession. I battled on and was seen. I then got my colonoscopy appointment through for July as a result of my going in that day.  
By the following Wednesday I was so bloated, looked about 6 months pregnant, had back pain, my knees were starting to give way intermittently and I called my doctor on the Thursday saying that I could not go on as I was. my movements of blood and mucus were about 20 plus times a day. Thankfully he saw me and sent me straight into the AMU to go straight to the gastro ward for my camera and x-ray. I went in good faith and was so grateful to now be in the system and feel I was getting somewhere. I had the camera on my left hand side on the Friday morning.. with no pain relief or sedation whatsoever.. my sister in law who is a gastro consultant was absolutely horrified.  
I was screaming and crying in SO much distress and pain (childbirth was way easier with no pain relief).. I eventually got some gas and air but they couldn't carry on and said they’d seen the big inflammation so knew they could treat me on steroids. And wait for full colonoscopy in July. I was absolutely traumatised by this and then went on to have failed cannulas which couldn’t go into my vein (still very bruised days later).. used my same vein for all the many bloods taken (still incredibly bruised to the point i asked if perhaps they could find another vein or arm!?) they put a cannula in the top of my hand which is fine but so painful and then proceeded to take my blood pressure all from this same left arm, my veins were stinging and throbbing.. it really is basic common sense and I had to keep asking/reminding for it to be taken in my other arm.  
The steroids were pushed into my cannula so quickly and stung me so badly (depending on which nurse I had)….. it was just all so awful, I spent most of my four nights sobbing, feeling harrowed, triggered from a past abuse I’d had .. bruised inside out and mentally. Some of the staff were so lovely and I honestly feel that they just don’t have the time to care .. it’s so sad.  
I was very lucky to have my own room which was a saving grace. I really hope others do not have to go through this. And both the consultants I saw were just so sad that I had had to suffer for so long and got lost in the covid system. The discharging consultant was so sorry about my experience in A&E and congratulated me so much on getting myself there and to this point. They think it is suspected crohn’s or ulcerative colitis but I am still waiting over 10 days after my biopsies which I was told would be a week for the results. I didn’t get to see a doctor for the whole weekend I was there despite being told on the Saturday that they were coming back to see me and at a 10 pm when I couldn’t stay awake I asked are they coming and they said, no I’m sorry they aren't……  
I could go on but that’s some of it.. and one nurse wouldn’t even look up and get me my water, I needed it as blood pressure was reading low.. so I went back and asked them where the tap was so I could do it myself.. they eventually got up and was so grumpy and unpleasant in their nature and attitude.  
Thank you and I hope you can prevent others from having an experience like this and I am lucky that despite feeling so weak and broken that I engineered being seen. My GP is really sorry too. I had only come off anti depressants in april after 11yrs and am amazed not to be on them but determined not to be too!.  
thank you and best wishes

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Norfolk and Norwich University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: airzh65
title: Our deepest and heartfelt thanks
body:
As a result of a complication in pregnancy, the safest option for baby and I was to be induced early.  
I nervously attended DOU at Royal Victoria Hospital, maternity where I was met with the friendliest big smile from Midwife Nicola who reassured me and immediately put me at ease with the beginning of the induction process.  
Following this, I attended the induction of labour suite where I was cared for by Sr Victoria and team. The induction suite, despite the business of the environment had such a chilled-out atmosphere which greatly helped to relieve anxieties.  
When the time came for me to be transferred to the delivery suite, my husband and I were transferred round by the lovely Midwife Deirbhle. Deirbhle listened attentively to all my wishes and went above and beyond to ensure that these were met as much as possible.  
We were then cared for by Midwife Kirsty. Like Deirbhle, Kirsty too listened to all our wishes, answered endless questions, ensured that all our requests were met in a kind and courteous manner. After asking Kirsty about an epidural, we were soon met by anaesthetic Dr McCarter. Dr McCarter was calm and reassuring and ensured that I was soon a lot more comfortable!  
Following some complications, Dr McCorkindale quickly arrived. I was extremely nervous at the thought of medical interventions, however, everything was explained perfectly to my husband and I, and I soon knew I was in the best of hands to help my little one arrive into the world safely. Dr McCorkindale was just exceptional.  
Dr McCorkindale was assisted by Midwives Claire, Lavelle and Teresa who were all so warm and kind.  
I required a longer stay in the delivery suite due to complications. I was so impressed with the continuity of care as I was then looked after again by Midwife Deirbhle. I was very poorly and Deirbhle helped me so much, from reminding me to feed my baby, to making tea and toast for my husband and I- and everything inbetween!  
Our deepest and heartfelt thanks to all of those mentioned above. We are truly grateful for the wonderful care that we received.  
Also our extended thanks to the entire teams on the ward rounds, and to those whose names we regretfully failed to catch.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: R.Paterson
title: I had an operation to remove a Basil Carcinoma
body: This is the fourth or fifth time I have had this procedure done and was aware of how the operation would be carried out. Both of the nurses David and Angela who carried out my operation were highly efficient, professional and a credit to the NHS. The procedure was explained to me in detail and how I should look after the wound over the coming days and weeks.

readBy.name: MASScot- Melanoma Action and Support Scotland

author: Mikb
title: Wait times for Blood tests
body: I have recently have had to book a blood test for my condition. What surprised me was the time delay at each location, some up to nearly a month. Although I would consider my needs as not urgent, I suspect others may be. What is in motion to reduce these waiting times for such minor procedure.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Extremely helpful Practice Nurse
body: I want to thank the Practice nurse on duty yesterday morning 30/6/2021, who was so helpful in diagnosing my wife Mary Leigh and arranging antibiotics for her condition so quickly. She was very understanding and efficient and I would like her to know I now have my lovely wife back to the way she was after taking two of the antibiotics. Many thanks to you.

title: Great Practice
body: The MH medical centre is an excellence practice and outstanding example of how a medical centre should operate. In a town that is outgrowing it’s infrastructure the service provided and levels of patient care are of the highest standard and the local community is extremely lucky to have such a good medical centre

author: Farhia.
title: Lack of mental health beds
body:
We called for a ambulance and the police as the patient was clearly acutely psychotic at 12. 45 on their arrival it was 13. 15. The patient was held under a section 131 we were told there was a lack of bed in Sheffield and the surrounding cities, however this ‘searching for beds’ lasted from 13. 15 - 17. 00 where the patient was clearly distressed and aggravated we were told that he would be assessed at the Longley centre the patient was sat on the floor as the staff stated the didn’t have a bed for the patient.  
I felt the treatment was horrific no human should be treated I this manner the police, paramedics and community mental health nurse that was present have all made the separate complaints and said this should never happened. I am appalled with the lack of treatment we were sat in A&E and was told the earlier the patient can be assessed will be 22. 00, how is that allowed to happen?

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

author: Sharonoo
title: Getting help for covid symptoms
body:
I developed covid symptoms over night. Tight cough pain in my chest which I managed till the morning. I booked a PCR test for 10am.  
On return I felt unwell and I was concerned that because I couldn’t cough properly due to the sharp pain it would cause me further issues. I called the 111 number which stated that the call is for people who need urgent help, at this point I did not feel I needed urgent help and as a nurse I felt my symptoms could be managed by a GP.  
I called my GP surgery and asked for advice I explained that I had asthma, that I had a terrible sharp pain in my chest on coughing and asked what advice are they giving or a recommendation for medication. I was met with the reply asking a prescription for what. I told the receptionist I have just explained why. They then proceeded to tell me a GP would not see me. I told them I understood a GP would not see me however I would like a telephone consultation to which they replied fine.  
This was all through struggling to talk due to a sore throat and painful cough. I waited 4 and half hours for a call back. When I didn’t receive a call back I called the surgery to find out when I would get to speak to a dr. I deliberately gave my house number as we have had issues in the past with calls to mobiles. I called 80 times which is visible on my phone whenever I pressed the appropriate number to get through the call dropped. I then changed and opted for another option this dropped too.  
I then went through the house call option and I tried to explain there is an issues with their telephone system. The receptionist was rude and said I would just need to keep trying as they are in the process of transferring their phone system. Again I tried to explain I had tried 80 times and I thought it was ridiculous they are changing over a phone system and people are trying to get help. They then took my name and said they Dr has tried called several times and they had no answer. Now my husband is an IT engineer he checked the phone and it was working he also withheld his number and tried and it was working.  
The receptionist then told me I needed to get off the line and they would inform the dr. I said I am calling for help I have been waiting for 4.5hrs in pain and I think it’s ridiculous that patients are being treated like this because they have COVID symptoms. At this point I became upset and crying as I was being met by someone completely unsympathetic. I explained that I am a nurse and I never use my GP service unless I need help and I am unable to get that help when required. It seemed very clear that this person didn’t care. I have 2 young children with the possibility of having covid and I was frightened, my oldest daughter (8) was becoming frightened and all I wanted was someone to listen to my symptoms and possible prescribe steroids due to my asthma. I told this person I was about to call NHS 24 and report this carry on that they should be dealing with patients and their response was and what are they going to do, I also said it needs reporting to the department of health.  
My husband heard the full conversation and took the phone from me. He was angry and asked for the receptionist name which they never gave due to my husband and being angry they hung up. My husband called again and spoke to someone who seemed to help a bit more, and informed us of their colleague's name. I then took the decision to call 111 where I was assessed and called back by a GP who was extremely helpfully who prescribed steroids and gave me another prescription for my inhaler. During this call the GP called to say that they had been trying to call and the call wasn’t going through. I explained that my landline is completely working I think it’s a bit of a coincidence that they were changing phone systems and calls were unable to connect.  
I am really disappointed that I have been treated in the way. I never access my GP unless I have to and I was met with this response. Reception staff acted unsympathetic and they are not upholding NHS Lanarkshire values. I work in hospital where staff are dealing with covid everyday face to face yet I can’t get help from a GP over the phone. I think community services is a sorry state of affairs and A&Es are full because patients can’t get access to a GP service when needed.

author: staceysigns
title: Fibroids.... the never ending battle
body:
In 2017 I was diagnosed with 2 small fibroids. These didn't cause me too many issues at the time. However, over the years they grew and more symptoms and issues have become an added challenge in my life. In 2019 things became apparent that they were getting worse, and worse in 2020, and even more so now than ever. I feel like I have seen doctors, again and again, to tell me what "could happen" to help, but those things never happen.  
I have shared with the doctors that due to cancer, which is hormonal related, in my family, I didn't want to go on hormones to "improve" things. One particular Dr. throughout this process has been the most difficult to deal with. They have people that work under them, and the first person I met was great. There was no follow-up, however, and everything that has happened since has been because I chased it. This Dr. has made me feel unheard, that my issues were minor and that they are unable to help me, particularly because of COVID-19 and not seeing patients face to face. Each conversation we have had their tone has been condescending and rushed.  
Today, I know that one of the fibroids is just about 10 CM. It is pushing on my bladder and my spinal cord, which is creating a form of sciatica in my leg. It causes disrupted sleep, pressure on the pelvic area, low libido (particularly due to the pain during intercourse), back pain, painful periods, cramps, bloating, and heavy bleading. Over the years, I have been told I just need to lose weight- I am an active individual who goes to the gym 3 x. a week, walks 2x a day, hikes on weekends, and eats a homemade healthy diet. I used to be a runner, and now I can't run due to the pressure on the bladder and the fact that running makes me pee myself- not a good look. I could go on.  
I have been patient, awaiting letters and following the system. Trusting that it will be ok and that the surgery that I should be scheduled for will happen. Over the last few weeks, I have felt worse and decided I should call the gynecology department and let them know and seek some guidance. The doctor did phone me back last week, which I missed due to work, and they followed up as they said they would today. Immediately on the phone, I got the same impression that I normally get- fobbed off, unheard, and basically spoken to in a tone of pure condescension. They accused me of being anxious about wanting to know when the surgery would be yes, I am curious, but the real reason for my call is that I am currently in pain. They told me I should go to my GP because my pain could be something else- sure it Could be something else, but I know that its the same pain, just worse. Not to mention, every time I have gone to the GP, they basically can't help me and need to then send me back to the gynaecologist. Apparently, the GP can "assess" if it's urgent. Circles... the system just puts me in a never-ending loop.  
This Dr. has read me notes, not remembered my name, my case, and seems to have no clue as to what is going on with me as their patient. Patient Centred Care does not seem a priority. In fact, when we did speak in early June this doctor asked me questions about the conversation that I had with the surgeon- questions that they should have answers to, or be able to find out, answers that I didn't have (e.g. did the surgeon want more imaging, did I need medication before surgery and when that should be started). First, I am not a medical doctor, and second by asking me these questions reaffirms that you have no clue what is going on in my case.  
The surgeon I spoke to told me that the position and size (" a whopper") was worth removing. I spoke to someone else as well, and asked if I could be on both waiting lists- one for the embolisation, one for surgery- as hey, getting any procedure is better than none. Apparently you are not allowed to be on two lists. Nor is there a clear system of care when you are dealing with an issue that people don't seem to care about, it won't kill me, so who cares about my quality of life? So I continue to wait, for the surgery, as if I can get it removed then hopefully this is the last time I have to deal with this unit. We don't know how long the wait will be... how many more months/years I don't know. I am only 37, can't imagine having kids now after carrying a tumour for so long, and struggle to see the point of healthcare, when they don't show any care.

author: Marys daughter
title: Active Recovery Team supporting my 83 year old Mum
body:
Active Recovery Team supporting my 83 year old Mum after breaking her arm.  
What a fantastic service this is. My Mum lives alone is very stubborn and fiercely independent, but after breaking her right arm recently she was visited by the fantastic Active Recovery team who sorted out some home adaptations to help her get upstairs, a bath board so she could have a bath. They helped her sort her pillows so she could sleep better too,  
They were beyond helpful, always rang me when they attended if I wasn't there and whenever I rang for advice were very kind and helpful. I cant remember every ones name but they were all great and a special mention for Patrick and his blue dots  
I cant praise the staff highly enough, they are absolutely excellent. I'm just gutted shes been discharged now

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: violetyc37
title: I didn't feel I had any control
body:
I was sent for a sigmoidoscopy at Wishaw November 2020 and unfortunately it was an awful experience.  
The nurses who prepped me were lovely and I was hopeful I'd have a good experience however when I went into the room to have the procedure done it was a very different atmosphere. The nurse (who I assumed was senior) was very unfriendly and rude, and was annoyed that I had underwear on, which I'd been told by another nurse to keep on because I was on my period. I tried to explain and was cut off and told to "hurry up".  
The actual procedure was excruciating, I was in so much pain. I was never asked if I wanted to stop and wasn't made aware that I could stop the procedure. At no point was I spoken to during the procedure explaining what was happening, in fact I wasn't even told when it was starting - the first I knew was when the Dr inserted a finger inside me and I was in pain (then after someone said, you've just had a rectal exam). I was rushed to sign the paperwork, wasn't allowed to ask questions and nothing was explained.  
I was supposed to be given sedation but I don't even know if I actually got this, and they were annoyed that I asked for it - I was offered no pain relief at all. I've had sedation twice to have wisdom teeth extracted and it was nothing like this. I felt everything, including the biopsies (which I wasn't told would be taken). I was thankful that one nurse was kind enough to let me hold her hand throughout or I think I would have pushed the Dr and other staff off me. I know other people who've had scopes (at other hospitals) under sedation who didn't remember a thing and were not in pain, so I assume mine wasn't administered correctly. After the procedure was over, I was rushed out of the room unable to put underwear back on, again told to hurry up despite how sore I was.  
I felt absolutely humiliated, and like no one (apart from that one nurse) cared about my welfare at all. I was crying going home because I was so sore and even months on I get panic attacks thinking about the experience. My experience at Wishaw hospital has massively contributed to my fear of hospitals and doctors/nurses. I recently had wisdom teeth out at Monklands and every member of staff there was caring, compassionate and I was given lots of options so that I had some control over my care - the opposite to the experience I had at Wishaw. During my sigmoidoscopy, I was treated like a lump of meat, not a person. The Dr didn't care about me at all, I don't think they actually spoke to me throughout. I might have signed consent forms but nothing about it felt consensual - I didn't feel I had any control over what was happening.  
The whole thing was awful, I would never go back there again - I'd rather wait longer to be seen somewhere else. I can't explain how frightening and dehumanising the experience was. You'd think, with a procedure as intimate as that, the staff would be trying their best to put you at ease and keep you as modest as possible, and try to ensure the patient is as comfortable and pain free as possible.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: guidewf73
title: Podiatry & wound care
body: My friend suggested I ring up to give my feedback to the lovely podiatry girls I have been under for 1. 5 years, they are always very good and efficient and I just wanted to thank them for helping me with the terrible trouble ive been having with my big toe. The appointments have been quick and very little wait time. Thanks to the 3 girls.

author: Beejal85
title: Home birth
body:
I had my daughter via home birth in 06/2021. The home birth team in my area are called the Crocus team. I just have to say that the midwives in the Crocus team are just absolutely brilliant! A midwife called Rebecca attended in the morning to look after me and then by 8am, Lucy and Andrea took over. I felt so calm and relaxed in their presence, even when they came to monitor me throughout labour, I felt relaxed and felt they weren't disturbing me at all.  
They were truly amazing, and cleaned up after I had given birth. They also made great conversation with my husband which helped him stay relaxed too. I wouldn't have had my home birth without their help, so I just wanted to say a huge thank you to Lucy, Andrea and Rebecca for looking after me so well, your help will never be forgotten.

author: previouslyanurse
title: Delighted
body:
I am 85 years old and I had a serious arm fracture over a month ago, I used to be a nurse myself and can I just say how wonderfully I was treated by all staff both in A&E and the Fracture Clinic. I cant use a computer but I wanted to have this documented so the staff could hear my praise.  
I was over the moon with the care and so over whelmed by how wonderfully I was treated in hospital. Thanks you so much.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: emcc009
title: Emergency Contraception
body:
I attended my local contraception clinic to have an emergency IUD inserted. I was very worried and anxious after having unprotected sex. The contraceptive nurse and doctor that I saw were most helpful and really put me at ease as they could tell I was nervous.  
They listened to my concerns and answered all of my questions with clarity. During the IUD insertion, they kept me calm and told me how well I was doing. They were Oonagh and Aisling in John Mitchell Clinic and I am so grateful for their care and help.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: goelan
title: diagnostic services - very bad
body:
The psychiatrist I saw for an ADHD assessment acted very badly (complaints passed on to the GMC). Including stating that most people get diagnosed with ADHD so they can get amphetamines on the NHS, and that noone with ADHD could get a degree.  
I now have a diagnosis from another provider that completely contradicts what they said.  
They told me there would be a follow-up appointment, but this never happened and when I asked about it a few months later I was told they had left the service. When I asked to see someone else, I was told I would have to go to the bottom of a two-year waiting list.  
What's worse, I have now learned that assessments for autism and ADHD are no longer actively taking place at Livewell Southwest. Several people I have spoken to were told that their only option was to pay for a private assessment outside of the NHS. My badly-conducted assessment was bad enough, but if they are no longer providing the services they are supposed to, I think that is abandonment of the vulnerable people they are commissioned to support. I had to have an assessment from a private psychiatrist last year, after my GP informed me that a referral to Livewell Southwest would go nowhere.

author: Smackweasel
title: Getting my first jab
body: Absolutely professional from start to finsh. Thank you

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: SadyLady
title: Such an easy process
body:
Today I went to the drop in at Argos Glenrothes for my 1st dose of the covid19 vaccine, having missed my first appointment due to illness.  
Everyone was so welcoming and kind. It was such an easy process, everyone explained fully what steps were to be taken/where to go etc.  
Thank you especially to Gail who spoke me through the vaccine process and discussed the ins and outs with me being pregnant and to Simon who actually vaccinated me.

author: disinfectantyq87
title: Double wisdom tooth extraction
body:
I had my 2 right wisdom teeth removed. The staff prior to my procedure were lovely and supportive, but after the procedure I felt that the care level dropped.  
- I received conflicting information from different members of staff about medication - I was told that I was being prescribed codeine by one member of staff but it turned out not to be the case  
- I was told I would receive another dose of codeine and oramorph before discharge which also never happened  
- I was never given a proper bed, instead I was left on a trolley  
- I was discharged with SPO2 which was flickering between 93 and 95, low blood pressure and a high heart rate - I wasn't allowed to walk out of the hospital because it was too low  
- my discharged letter states that I should have received a pack to stop bleeding if it should have occurred, which was also never given  
- the call buzzer in the bay I was in either didn't work, or was ignored when pressed

author: Lynne s
title: Disrespectful staff
body:
Lack of communication for my daughters admission  
But more than that the staff on meau ward acted terribly unprofessional and uncaring and nasty . There was a vulnerable patient afraid and left not able to feed themselves and the staff were mimicking them very loudly and laughing about them at the nurses station. It was incredibly sad and upsetting.  
I was on the ward overnight to keep my daughter calm but I was totally disgusted by staff that are supposed to care for us .  
Also when taking groin swabs on another patient the staff member did not draw the curtains so no privacy for the patient . This was just a couple of examples of what I feel is a terribly run ward  
I would be grateful of feed back

author: horologiumyw96
title: Vaccine
body: I am pregnant and the advice and reassurance couldn’t be better. Great team and so efficient. Delighted

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Anne123
title: my 12 weeks in 3 north
body: I have been in Craigavon 12 weeks in a private side room in 3 North. During my stay here the staff have been exceptional. I have made really good relations with them and it has made my time less daunting as I've spent most of 2 years in and out of hospitals between Craigavon and the city hospital. A domestic staff cleaner has been amazing each week and she makes sure everything is perfect as I have a touch of OCD and I believe is a credit to the ward. My only issue during my stay here has been the lack of cleaning on the ward when this cleaner is off, my bins overflow, cloths left lying on the window bench for two days and the floors were dirty so I had to clean them myself on my knees which was difficult as I am quite ill. However my medical care is excellent and the staff are brilliant.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: scrubs123
title: Minor injuries CAH
body: I suffered a fall yesterday in my bathroom of my own house and unfortunately hurt my right knee so my husband and I came into minor injuries today to get it checked out as it was quite sore. All of the staff today have been great and I have no criticism apart from the wait time. My husband and I have been sitting waiting for 40+ minutes but we understand how busy all the staff are and know they are doing all they can as fast as they can.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: whitehouse1
title: My time at the ambulatory service
body: I have had a really good experience. All the staff have been excellent and it is nice and calm environment. I only had to wait an hour and a half to be seen and I thought it would be far longer so I'm very grateful.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: rob5
title: Lack of wheelchairs entering CAH
body: I had to take my mum into the minor injury unit today and when I entered I was shocked to see no wheelchairs on entry. I looked about for some to no avail and when I finally found one lying about it was beyond repair, the wheels wouldn't roll and it was falling apart, unsafe. The staff have been great but I think there needs to be more wheelchairs available and in a particular place on entry for the future.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: HM86
title: Early pregnancy assessment. Ongoing bleeding
body:
I am currently pregnant with twins and have had to attend the EPAU four times in just a few weeks due to bleeding/spotting. Each time I've been exceptionally anxious as I have a history of missed miscarriage and high risk pregnancies. Each time I've been cared for very professionally and sensitively. Anytime I have spoken to a midwife or sonographer everything has been explained to me fully and with compassion. The over the phone triage process was also always carried out as quickly as possible and with thorough assessment.  
Everyone has been so kind but (midwife) Jane stands out in my mind as I dealt with her the most - 3 out of the 4 visits. She impressed myself and my husband with her knowledge and kind professionalism. Can't praise and thank everyone enough for their help in an extremely stressful time.

title: Terrible receptionists
body: Have bee with inclusion for almost a year now. Apart from one or two doctors here actually doing their job, the receptionists are rude and eager to put the phone down. Occasionally picking it up and ending the call as soon as you manage to get through the very long automated message at the start of the call which is highly misleading - advising that you call after 10AM for an appointment when I'm fact you absolutely must play on luck and dial their number at 07:59:99AM to secure the slimmest chance of an appointment. Apart from that some doctors here wont listen to your actual problem, the just write it down and then move onto their next task with little attention paid. Doctors notes and medical letters commonly forgotten about being issued. All these things have happened to myself and others registered at this place. Not at all the outstanding service that their receptionists claim to offer.

title: Poor Reception
body: I have been a patient with Clover City Practice for almost 3 years, and in that time there has been at least 14 to 16 occasions where I have telephoned the GP reception to order my medication that has been prescribed for me, and the receptionists have not forwarded my request for my monthly medication to the doctor's so it can be signed off and forwarded/ordered at the pharmacy for me to collect... this has meant that I have made many trips to the pharmacy at my expense to go and collect expected medication only to be told that to prescription for my medication has been sent... which has meant that I have thus had to further contact the GP to order my medication a second time, after a wasted journey, leading to further expense for making a second journey on many, many occasions to collect needed medication.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great consultant,  Anesthetists  and theatre…
body:
Arrive for my spinal procedure on 18/6/21 to Levington  ward.
I was very nervous and worried  but was immediately made to feel so comfortable by the Anaesthetists chat and fun before being put to sleep.  This really made a difference to me, especially when due to COVID we had  to come in alone.  
I also found my surgeon very explanatory of the procedure and making sure several times I understood what was going to happen etc. 
He had a lovely manor and just made me feel at ease which is really important.  
Unfortunately I had a few issues with a couple of the nursing staff issues which has been addressed but in the main the ward staff including the tea/ coffee staff were cheerful and helpful 
Thank you for your care

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great treatment
body: I have nothing but gratitude for everyone I met during my procedure.After nearly 16 months of COVID 19 these wonderful people who must be exhausted went out of their way to make sure I was given the best treatment possible thankyou!

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent practice
body: While the whole practice is excellent, I want to particularly praise the receptionists. I have been a patient at many practices around the country and the receptionists at Tramways are the most friendly and helpful I have come across.

title: A good Practice doing their best in difficult…
body: I found the e consult form worked very well.  I was called by a doctor and after discussion an appointment was arranged for a face to face consultation.  Blood tests carried out at the same time.  Problem sorted very quickly and efficiently.

title: Poor practice via e consult
body: I completed the e consult as requested, i heard nothing back having requested a certain GP, i rang the reception to see why I hadn’t heard back, the receptionist was very helpful and said that the e consult had been answered and a reply text/emailed back, i had not received either, e consult is dangerous, it advises most symptoms to dial 999. You get emails with a response that does not allow you to speak and explain thing to a GP. Also when people come to the window to book, they are being asked the reason for an appointment in front of a queue of people over the intercom so everyone can hear no patient confidentiality.

title: Such kindness
body: I had my Covid jabs there with great ease and efficiency, but the 2nd one didn't get registered.  After a lot of uncertainty and stress,  I finally realised I had to contact the place where the vaccination was done.  Every single person I spoke to on the phone was kind and reassuring,  and when a wonderful computer whizz finally added my 2nd jab to the NHS record,  they had the compassion to ring me and tell me it was all done.  Thank you,  St John's!

title: Poor service
body:
I am sorry to have to say in my view after always having first class service the practice it has gone backwards with wait times for phone appointments which seems to the the norm now taking forever and a face to face appointment with your own GP ( if you can get to see your own GP) does not happen without a lot of pushing.
The continuous interruptions when on hold are very annoying as they override what else you are being told.
On a positive side the reception staff are very helpful once you get through and do try to help.

title: Rude receptionist
body: I’ve called the reception today twice asking a normal question in a very polite way and the receptionist was very rude, hostile and raising the voice at me which I do not appreciate.

readBy.name: Sherwood Forest Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic
body: I had to attend the a+e department for treatment on my eye, I was worried and scared but I needn't have been as all the staff were so kind and caring and made me feel very at ease and relaxed. The nurse and nurse practitioner that treated me were absolutely amazing I could not thank them enough. I left the department worry free and smiling. Thankyou all so much for the jobs you do.

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Fabulous care
body: In A&E I couldn’t have had better care or attention from all the staff. Transferred to Acute Medical Unit the care was excellent and when I had to follow up after trying to contact my GP to no avail I spoke to a lovely lady and a Dr on the AMU and both were extremely helpful, reassuring and relieved my stress. Thank you for the care and attention.

title: Bad experience
body:
I had a phone consultation with a psychiatrist who was rude and disrespectful.
Put me on hold while I was speaking...
Refused to diagnose and major attitude problem...

readBy.name: Birmingham and Solihull Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Get up to date
body: Is it not about time that the practice used cheaper emails to contact patients instead of expensive letters and phone messages .After all saving money for the NHS should be a priority.come on get up to date !

title: Overall very positive service
body:
Two compliments this morning:
1.	Pleasure at the ‘new’ wait system offering the opportunity to Press 1 to retain your position in the queue, hang up and be called back when near the head of the queue.  I tried it and fully 15mins later got a call-back and I was at position 2.  Well done.
2.	Sending in photos:  I offered to send a few photos to help your GP, when she calls me later, and was reminded me of the ‘florey’ link you send, allowing upto 5 images to be sent in.  I have successfully used this before and want you to know, how much it is appreciated.

Also, apparently, a significant compliment to Archwood regarding the relative ease we have had in recent months in being offered face-to-face appts. when needed.  We have had expressions of surprise from a couple of others recently elsewhere.

Keep up the Good Work!

author: jazzxy66
title: No need to feel embarrassed
body: As someone in their late 30s I was pretty embarrassed to think I had an STD. I was apprehensive about attending the clinic but knew I had to be checked. The ladies who looked after me were brilliant, I could be open and honest without any judgement and they treated and reassured me these things happen and I’d done the right thing getting checked. I was treated and fully checked. Was painless and overall a positive experience. No one should feel ashamed or embarrassed it’s far better to be checked and treated and you’ll maybe be more mindful next time!

author: Orbiter 400
title: Same day Covid 19 test
body:
I have previously attended the testing cell in November 2020.
Much easier and less stressful than before. It saved a small amount of travel time. The information leaflet was useful and I am very happy with the service I have received and would be happy to use it again.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good experience
body: Easy and very informative. Professional staff informed and explained to me every procedure. Quick service.

title: Useless e- consult form
body:
I have been a patient with the practice for over 20yrs. The reception staff are generally friendly and helpful however, there's one lady who seems to take particular delight in talking down to people,  especially on the phone. I do not appreciate being spoken to like a child , 
" I told you , you have to do an e- consult form!" was what I was told. What on earth was wrong with making an appointment for a telephone consultation right then when I was actually speaking with a receptionist!? It would have taken her literally 2 minutes to take a few details instead of the at least 10 minutes of filling in an econsult form. Pardon me, but isn't that part of what a receptionist does? The econsult form itself is NOT user friendly & is unnecessarily long !
Whilst I'm here, can you please tell me whether face to face consultations will be available for patients that prefer that ? Obviously, those with possible C19 symptoms would not be invited into the surgery but there are some health issues that need to be looked at & examined physically.  Please can we get back to some normality .

title: Dissapointed! Close this surgery!
body: Called at 8.03 was in position 5. At 8.30 i decided to drive to surgery which was 2 mins away. Went inside am in position 2 on hold. The lady receptionist is talking to another colleague about her daily life. She sees me then answer the call she had on hold. Tells them they will book them with a doctor. She then speaks to me told her i need to book a doctors appointment she said i have to call and be patient cause they staff have better things to do. I left the surgery upset and registered with another surgery.

title: Great practice
body: We would like to express our sincere thanks to all the medical staff who have given us excellent support and care throughout a time of being unwell.  We have been patients at the medical centre since we came to this area nearly 25 years ago and have always been very impressed with the help we have received.

title: Great practice from Practice Nurse
body:
I had an appointment yesterday with one of the nurses at Woodlands. She was so lovely and professional and really made me feel at ease during the appointment, chatting to me and just generally being lovely. I needed an appointment for a pill check and didn’t realise this couldn’t just be given as a repeat prescription. I mentioned this to the nurse at my appointment and she did my pill check up there and then for me and gave me a new prescription. Nothing was too much trouble and she just gave so much of her time. She gave me lots of further information about my pill which I found really helpful. 

I’ve been a patient at Woodlands for a number of years now and honestly can’t fault the care from the doctors or nurses.

author: normapx58
title: Not being heard.
body:
Any opinions I have aired in the last year or so I feel have been dismissed. I feel that my feelings will be disregarded as they previously have. Some of the service users I have spoken with are all concerned that they will have their script taken away including separate ones which are prescribed by their GP.  
No one wants to speak out in fear of that situation. I'm low on my reduction and I feel that I am at an important stage needing follow up care on a more regular basis. Since my medical review early June I am yet to hear from my support worker.  
I've had to ask for professional support elsewhere. My voice has not been heard at all. I feel like I have been blocked at every turn.  
It's caused a massive toll on my family and friends and my emotional well being. You are supposed to be professionals, not use your knowledge to break people. I don't think the support staff have enough time or empathy for their clients.  
It is a huge concern.

title: very bad
body: I would never go back to this hospital the staff are rude and have no idea what is going on they moved me around none stop. Did not do as they said they was going to do. Asked the staff somethings and got nothing they just carried on with there own conversations and not bothered. The hospital was dirty blood all put side not cleaned up nothing. I would never step foot back in this hospital. They need to retain there staff on how to listen and talk to people. The nurse that I was at the start also hurt me with the blood pressure cuff that I had to rip of myself as it was not working right and has left marks and bruises on my upper arm. And they say there r there to help and eveything well I ended up walking out and finding a different hospital that has done more in a few hours then the 8 hours I was there at this this hospital

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Terrible Practice
body: Can't get appointments, phone system is dire, would happily change GP but all local are run by the same group so stuck with SMI, receptionist rude and unhelpful.

title: Amazing services and staff
body: I took my daughter to the department yesterday and even though we were there a good few hours the staff could not have done more to help. They were curious, friendly and went out of their way to make sure we were okay. I could not reccomend this department more and would not hesitate to take our children here again. Thankyou so much!

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very caring practice
body: My whole family are registered at this practice and we have always found the practice to be very caring. The doctors always give the time needed and I have never felt rushed in an appointment. They really looked after my grandma and went the extra mile to do things in a way helpful for her. The other staff including reception staff are also helpful and professional. The staff can speak multiple languages which really helps.

title: Great practice
body: I think this is agreat practice from doctors nurses and especially receptionist under these trying times

author: watergq65
title: The care I my husband and I received from the Major Trauma Team
body: After my Son had an accident to his abdomen and was admitted to ICU Lindsay and the Major Trauma Team were very helpful at giving us information on my son's situation and help us understand. It was great to have one point of contact for everything. In the beginning Lindsay helped us by taking a load off. She helped us cancel appointments we had and informed the school about my son. She made it clear if there was anything we needed just to contact her. Thank you to Lindsay and the team for being so kind, u understanding and helpful.

title: Fabulous Surgery and Amazing Staff!!
body:
The practice and staff are absolutely amazing! Whenever I have called for advice the staff are prompt in relaying my messages to the doctors/ nurses and I get a call back always on the same day.
All the doctors are pleasant and easy to speak with. 
The front staff are efficient in booking appointments when I need it. Always answer the telephone whenever I have called and not kept waiting as I know this is a busy practice.
During Covid time, the practice and staff have been incredibly helpful with advice in regards all Covid related and with the vaccine.
Happy that I’m a patient here!!

title: Poor service
body:
Waiting time for the appointment is ridiculously long- minimum 3 weeks for the phone appointment. And then, when you would not manage to pick up the phone because you were in the bathroom, the doctor would not even try to call you back straight away. They would call you back in few hours
Very bad experience

title: Patients & Staff Smoking
body:
Staff & patients use an area of The Chapters development to smoke when your whole site is non smoking, this has put off prospective buyers on several occasions & must be stopped. Please make it clear to your staff that they cannot use any of the Chapters development for any reason.
Regards
Bernard North

title: Fantastic team
body: I was seen today at the day surgery department and have to say a huge thank you to the team. I was blown away by the amazing nurses, healthcare team, surgeon and everyone else involved in a short procedure that was made as pleasant as possible by such a caring team of superstars!

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic Service
body: I have recently moved to Dyneley House and the experiences that I have had so far are fantastic, from the receptionist, e-consult and the speed of the reply from the doctor, to the appointment with the Physio, they are helpful, give you lots of detail, email followed with 12 hours of my appointment with detailed exercises on for me to follow,very professional can not recommend enough, WELL DONE!! I've had more information given to me than the last 20 years I ever got at my old Practise!!
